page.title: 01WESTLETON AND ITS 'WALKS'
page.content: Area - A holiday area of heathland, woods and marshes owned by The Nature Conservancy, National Trust (Dunwich Heath and the Royal Society for the Protection of Birds (Minsmere Reserve). The farmland has two owners. Part of Westleton is in the block, and there are two holiday caravan sites and self-catering flars on Dunwich Cliffs. Peope - Many people have retired to the village. Jobs are few; - farming, fishing, catering, gardening, land-drainage, housework and home-helps. Workers drive to other jobs. Children are bussed to schools in Middleton (Primary) and Leiston (Middle and High). Recreation - The Village Hall houses the W.I. Youth Club, Badminton Club, Craft and Painting Classes, Doctors Surgery and community activities.
